Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with symptomatic great saphenous vein (GSV) incompetence were randomized

Participants.evidence: Patients with symptomatic great saphenous vein (GSV) incompetence

Intervention.evidence: compare EVLA with two forms of RFA: direct RFA (dRFA; radiofrequency‐induced thermotherapy) and indirect RFA (iRFA; VNUS ClosureFast™)

Objective.evidence: The objective of this study was to compare EVLA with two forms of RFA

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was GSV occlusion rate

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients with symptomatic great saphenous vein (GSV) incompetence were randomized

Number_Randomised.evidence: Some 450 patients received the allocated treatment (EVLA, 148; dRFA, 152; iRFA, 150)

Number_Analysed.evidence: The intention‐to‐treat analysis showed occlusion rates

Result_Outcome.evidence: occlusion rates of 75·0 (95 per cent c.i. 68·0 to 82·0), 59·9 (52·1 to 67·7) and 81·3 (75·1 to 87·6) per cent respectively after 1 year

Harms.evidence: Significantly more adverse events were reported after treatment with EVLA (103) than after dRFA (61) and iRFA (65)
